channel.title: BETTERSQUASH
channel.description: If you are looking to improve your squash, you have visited the right website!

item.title: Don't Let The Ball Bounce Twice, Don't Hit The Tin, And Don't Hit It out!
item.description: You can't be serious? Are you telling me this is actually real advice?
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Rally Vision: A.I. Match Analysis
item.description: A new squash analytics service has been announced that provides new insights into your squash.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Why Do Some Squash Courts Have Concave Out Lines?
item.description: The answer is to make it easy to see if the ball is out or not. If the line is flat, that makes it hard to tell.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Better Than Nothing - Why Even Doing 5 Minutes Solo Drilling Is Worth It
item.description: If you want to improve, you have to practice. The more, the better - more or less. But what's the minimum that will make a difference?
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: The Three Stages Of Using A Red Dot Squash Ball
item.description: You probably think that using a red dot squash ball is easy. Well, it is, then it isn't and then it is again! Confused? Read on.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Which Ball Should you use when Solo Drilling?
item.description: Using the right squash ball at the right time is essential to ensure you maximise your time on a squash court AND make sure you have as much fun as possible.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: 3 Potentially Unpopular Opinions About Current Squash
item.description: In this short article, I talk about the Service Line, Diving and Foot Faults, and propose my solutions for the problems I believe they create.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Rackets Do Not Win Matches, Brains And Skill Do
item.description: Too many amateurs spend too much time, effort and energy worrying about equipment, when they should be focused on improving some aspect of their game.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Why Do You Play Better Squash When People Are Watching You?
item.description: If you are the type of person who does perform better with an audience, then try to imagine people watching when there aren’t any.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Dispelling Some Misconceptions About Squash
item.description: Ask non-squash playing people what they think, believe or have heard about squash and you will hear some of the misconceptions listed below.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Are You Thinking Short-Term Or Long-Term?
item.description: Want to win a particular match? Think short-term. Want to consistently improve? Think long-term. Let's explore the difference.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Set The Tone Of The Match From The First Rally
item.description: Have you ever played somebody who gave 100% from the very first point and who also was so focused that it was a little intimidating? Well, that could be you.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: 5 Dead Ball Drills To Improve Your Accuracy
item.description: Hitting the ball non-stop is great, but sometimes simply dropping the ball and hitting it once can help us improve our accuracy. Let me show you 5 different drills to do just that.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: The 5 Vs of Training: Volume, Velocity, Veracity, Variety and Value
item.description: In this article, I discuss how much training you should do, how fast you should do it, how *perfect* it should be, how many different exercises you should do and finally ensuring it's the right training for YOU.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Goldilocks Squash - Why Just Right Is Exactly As It Sounds!
item.description: There's a lot we can learn from a 190-year old nursery tale. Everything is about selecting just the right amount of something, be it power, speed, effort, excitement, because to put it bluntly: More is NOT always better.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Squash Rituals To Help You Play Better Squash
item.description: Having a custom that you follow before performing an important action can help reduce anxiety, focus your mind and improve performance. In this article, I discuss and explain some other ritual squash players perform.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Squash Etiquette Or Mind Games?
item.description: In sports, the line between what is considered polite behaviour and mind games can be a fine one. In this article, I'd like to look at some less common aspects that players should consider when considering squash etiquette.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Spatial Awareness In Squash
item.description: Knowing where your opponent and the back wall is at ANY given moment is an ability many squash players take for granted. It is possible to develop better Spatial Awareness though.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Should You Listen To Music When Performing Solo Drills?
item.description: Some people like to have background music playing when they do a variety of tasks. Does this help pass the time or does it hinder improvement?
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Track Your Squash Improvement
item.description: Sometimes it is difficult for squash players to notice improvements in their game. Tracking your progress via video can provide huge motivation as well as clues to what to work on next.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Treat Your Injuries Seriously
item.description: We all get injured. It's how you treat and manage those injuries that count.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: The ABC of Squash
item.description: Can you condense squash down to 3 words, but not just three words, 3 words that start with A, B and C? SophieBio believes you can - And I think I agree.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Which Is Correct: Racket Or Racquet?
item.description: Have you heard the phrase Win or learn? I don't agree with it and let me explain why.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Win Or Lose, Make Sure You Learn
item.description: Have you heard the phrase Win or learn? I don't agree with it and let me explain why.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Taking An Extended Break From Squash
item.description: Sometimes life gets in the way of squash and for many reasons you might not be able to play for a while. Let's look at things you can do to ensure you don't fall too far behind your nemesis
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: The Yellow Dot International Open Squash Championship 1974 Programme
item.description: I was very lucky to get my hands on this The Yellow Dot International Open Squash Tournament 1974 Programme, which has been signed by many of the players.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Shadow Swings Heat Up
item.description: Shadow swinging is the act of swinging the racket without the ball. It can be used to improve technique, but also as part of your heat up.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Beast Mode Solo Squash Routine
item.description: Develop improved ball control and concentration with this solo squash routine designed for competitive, ambitious club players
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Eleinen's Defensive Counter Drop - OneShot
item.description: Learning how to play a high defensive counter drop can give you a chance of winning the rally
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: What Is A Rally Reset Shot In Squash?
item.description: If you have watched any Squash TV, then you have probably heard this phrase before. What does it mean, and is it useful for club players though?
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Pay Attention To The Distance Between You And The Ball
item.description: Getting the distance between you and the ball just right can make the difference between a terrible shot and a great shot
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: How Often Do You Hit The Ball Deep From Deep?
item.description: We all know that professional squash players are fitter and more patient than club players, but what does the data say?
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: My 7 Maxims Of Squash: 2023 Edition
item.description: With the calendar year ended, I thought I would give you something to think about for this year's squash.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Give 100% From The Beginning
item.description: It's easy to think that with the best of 5 games, you have plenty of time to start playing hard, but from the moment you hit the first ball, you should be playing at your maximum intensity
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Your Swing: Prepare Early And Prepare Consistently
item.description: There is no perfect swing. If there were, then all professional squash players would have it. What is important is early preparation and consistent preparation.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Effective Counter Drops: Why Playing A Drop Shot Off A Drop SHots Is Often The Best Strategy
item.description: The ball goes where you hit it. But what controls that exactly? Read on to find out.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Pay Attention To Your Point Of Contact With The Ball
item.description: The ball goes where you hit it. But what controls that exactly? Read on to find out.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: There's More To Being A Professional Squash Player Than Playing Great Squash
item.description: Being a professional sports persons sounds glamorous, right? Travelling around the world, earning money doing something you love. What could be better?
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: The Role of Mindset in Squash Performance
item.description: The mental aspect of sport seems to be considered important only for elite performers, but let's take a moment to consider exactly what mindset means, and I think you might be surprised.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Don't Underestimate The Importance Of The Shape Of The Handle
item.description: The handle of the squash racket is the conduit between your body and strings. Through it, you control the racket head and consequently the ball.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Set Yourself Monthly Tactical Targets
item.description: Goal setting is considered obligatory for professional athletes, yet for club players it is often ignored. By setting tactical targets you could develop new strategies
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Mastering Different Tactics with the Right Squash Racket
item.description: Should You Change Squash Rackets To Change Your Tactics? It's a question I've been asked many times and one I've changed my answer to
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Is Hitting The Ball Down The Middle Of The Court That Bad?
item.description: Squash has changed a lot since its creation. All sports have. If we were to have 4k footage of squash from the very start we would be shocked at how different it is.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Use an Agility Ladder To Improve Your Ball Control
item.description: Using targets is a great way to focus your attention. Using a physical target that forces success or failure can be both helpful and frustrating
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Getting The Ball Out Of The Back Corners Makes Squash More Fun
item.description: A few articles ago, I asked whether being better at squash made it more fun? I certainly don't think it's a linear effect, but do feel the back corners are very important.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Start Your Own Training Squad
item.description: You can hope to get better or you can be proactive. One way is to get a small group of similar standard players together and have a weekly training squad.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Take The Opportunities You Create
item.description: I have been performing quite a few video analyses for players recently and one thing that appears time and time again is players not taking the opportunities that they create.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Forget About Improving Your Squash
item.description: It's currently trendy to talk about productivity, side-hustle, waking up before dawn, bullet journals and setting goals, and it's dangerous.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Playing Squash Against People Who Don't Know The Rules
item.description: Some players don't know the rules and some players don't *want* to know the rules, which is why being confident about the basic squash rules is so important.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Can You Hit Aces In Squash?
item.description: Absolutely! But it's much harder than in tennis for two reasons: firstly tennis players get two serves and secondly they are whimps! Just joking.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: What’s The Difference Between Hard And Smart training?
item.description: Hard training describes the amount of effort you put it. Smart training describes doing the most effective training. Often we train “hard”, sweat, feel like we accomplished a lot, yet it could be the totally wrong thing required to make you a better squash player.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Squash Tips For Solo Practice
item.description: Solo practice is one of the best things you can do to improve your squash. It mostly works on your skill, but with the right planning can also work on your fitness.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Why Do I have To Watch The Ball Hit My Strings?
item.description: It’s a natural question. It’s hard to do at first and seems to make watching the ball after you hit it really hard. So why even do it? Read on to find out more.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Squash Plus Outdoor Court
item.description: The pandemic has been the catalyst for squash to fight its way out of the dark and dingy corners of sports centres or private, often elite, clubs and into the sunshine (and rain!)
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Grays Illusion 110 Squash Racket
item.description: Overall, this is a well-performing racket, if a little too powerful for my liking.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: What’s The Difference Between Reaction Time And Anticipation?
item.description: Essentially, one is a physical process, the other mental.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: The Reverse Angle AKA The Leisure Centre Boast
item.description: What is the reverse angle shot? Why is it also called the Leisure Centre boast? Is that an insult or a compliment? Read on to find out.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: The More Serious You Are, The Less Creative You Should Be
item.description: The connection between squash and chess has been made many times, and most people who play squash and know a little about chess seem to agree with the concept.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Why Do Pro Squash Players Rally To The Back So Much?
item.description: Watch any professional match and you will always see lots of shots to the back of the court. Pro players seem to hit the ball to the back so much! Buy why? Read on to find out.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Figure Of Eight: Solo Drill
item.description: This drill is also called “The Butterfly”, but I prefer the name “infinity” as the shape the ball-path makes is more like the infinity symbol than an eight (∞ vs 8), also the idea that you could do the drill for infinity if you were good enough!
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: The Secret To Great Squash
item.description: Are you looking for that one trick that will suddenly make your squash great? Have you tried the latest fitness equipment that promises to maximize your time and abilities?
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Practice Your Serve And Service Return
item.description: The better you get, the less important the serve is, but the more important the return. At lower levels, both are incredibly important, yet generally neglected. Change that today!
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Play Weaker Players Not Just Better Players – Part 2
item.description: Yesterday, I explained why playing against different players can be better than playing against better players. Today, I want to explain how conditioned games against weaker players can improve your squash.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Play Different Players Not Just Better Players – Part 1
item.description: There’s a misconception among club players that you *should only play against better players* and it is so far from the truth. Let me tell you why.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: When Should You Get Squash Coaching?
item.description: The simple answer is NOW! There is no reason to wait. Well, there might be, for example don’t start coaching if you know you have to miss the next month or more’s worth of lessons!
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Introduce One New Person To Squash This Year!
item.description: Whose responsibility is it to make a sport grow? National organisations, The World Squash Federation, The Professional Tour? Club coaches? Equipment manufacturers?
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Participation Coach Vs Elite Coach
item.description: There are different kinds of coaches. Coaches whose objective is to get as many people playing and enjoying squash as possible. Coaches who focus on elite performers and helping them become the best they can be.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: What Level Of Squash Player Are You?
item.description: What does it matter if you are a “Beginner” or “Improver”? Honestly, not much, but for some, knowing more about the types of players around can help them enjoy the sport more.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Play With A Vintage Racket Once A Month
item.description: I’ve got to be crazy, right? Suggesting using an old racket. What a waste of time, right? Wrong. Read on to find out why it’s good for your squash.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Racketware Sensor
item.description: What if there was a way for you to accurately measure your swing? A way for you to record the angles and speed of you racket on impact with the ball? Well, there is!
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Can you play doubles on a singles squash court?
item.description: Yes, absolutely! Each player should be experienced though, so definitely no beginners. It helps if you have a good understanding of the rules related to Lets and Strokes too.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Time for a squash license?
item.description: Crazy right? Asking people to take a course before playing squash. What faster way is there to kill a sport? Well, firstly, it would be optional and secondly free.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Don’t Play With Shiny Squash Balls!
item.description: Too many new players think you can keep playing with a ball until it breaks and they are wrong, Oh so very very wrong.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Sharing A Squash Court For Solo Drilling
item.description: One thing I try to encourage players to do is share a court when doing solo drills. Many players think this is crazy: if there’s another player on court, why don’t we play?
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Can You Hit The Ball With Two Hands In Squash?
item.description: Can You Hit The Ball With Two Hands In Squash? Yes, there is nothing in the rules to stop you, but more importantly why do you want to?
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Squash Tennis
item.description: I am sure you have heard of Squash (duh!), tennis, racketball, and badminton, but the fact is, there are over 25 racket sports and this is the first in a monthly series exploring and introducing those sports.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: What’s The Difference Between Strategy And Tactics In Squash?
item.description: If you were to perform a search on the internet, I mean, not right now, but after this article, you would find some different definitions of strategy and tactics, but I feel confident in saying that most agree with what I am about to say.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Should I wear Squash Goggles?
item.description: Yes. Allow me to explain why.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Is Swimming Good For Squash Training?
item.description: The simple and direct answer is YES! However, like most activities, it also depends on doing it properly.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Squash Etiquette
item.description: Free online squash coaching videos and articles to improve your game
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: How To Use The Knock Up Effectively In Squash
item.description: The knock up is the moment that you go onto court and start hitting the ball in preparation for a friendly or competitive match. Simply hitting the ball to get it hot is NOT the main objective. You have three objectives when knocking up.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Should a beginner start with a heavy or light squash racket?
item.description: A lot depends on you. Are you strong? Are you having coaching or have good technique?
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: What’s The Difference Between a Stroke and a Let In Squash?
item.description: Unlike many racket sports, squash players share the same space: the court!
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Can I serve Overarm in squash?
item.description: Yes, no problem, go ahead, sure, but the question you should ask yourself is what benefit do I get?
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Can I Use A Red Dot Ball In Squash Solo Drills?
item.description: There is a lot of confusion regarding the colour of the dots on squash balls and their use. This confuses is NOT your fault – it is the major manufacturers and the World Squash Federation (WSF)
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Is Diving Allowed In Squash?
item.description: The simple answer is yes. However, the only specific mention of it I could find in the WSF Rules of Singles Squash 2020 was related to self-inflicted injuries.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: How To Hit The Ball Hard In Squash
item.description: Everybody loves to hit the ball hard, right? I sure do. But I also want to hit it accurately, otherwise You might be causing yourself more problems than you solve!
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Consistent Squash Training
item.description: “Consistency” is a very important word in performance. But this article is about consistent training and why that can be the key to improving your squash.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Should I Continue Playing Squash When I am Injured?
item.description: A lot depends on the type of injury and how you did it, but the simple answer is NO!
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: The Benefits Of Solo Practice In Squash
item.description: Very few sports allow you to improve your skill on your own in the same way that squash does.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Please Play The Lob When Under Pressure!
item.description: Squash is often about hitting the ball hard and fast. Trying to punish any weak return with a nick or winner.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Playing Squash After Taking A long Break
item.description: Sometimes we have to stop playing squash. This could be due to work or family commitments, injuries or many other reasons. If we are lucky, we eventually come back to squash.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: What’s The Best Way To Improve Your Squash Footwork?
item.description: Moving around the squash court efficiently and effectively is key to playing well.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: How To Choose The Right Squash Ball
item.description: One aspect of squash that can be confusing to new players, and some who have been playing a while, is the different balls.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: How Often Should You Replace Squash Strings?
item.description: Squash strings should be replace regularly. The often quoted frequency is how ever many times you play per week, change your squash strings per year
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Which Squash Racket Frame Shape is Better?
item.description: Squash rackets come in two main head/frame shapes: tear drop and traditional. Each have their advantages and disadvantages and in this article, I’ll be talking about them
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: What Are Condition Games In Squash?
item.description: A “Conditioned Game” in squash means limiting what shots players can play or by giving players specific “rules” or points of focus
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: What Are The Basic Shots In Squash Called?
item.description: Like all sports, squash has terms and names related just to itself. Knowing those names won’t make you a better squash player, but will make it easier to understand what you see and read about squash
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: How Hard Should I Hit The Squash Ball?
item.description: It can be very tempting to want to hit the squash ball as hard as you can. The sound it makes and the feeling you get seem to make it worthwhile, but you need to ask yourself “What benefit did it bring?”
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: What Are the Lines On A Squash Court For?
item.description: The first thing you should know about the lines in squash is that unlike tennis or badminton, where the lines are considered “in”, in squash if a ball hits a line, any line, it is out.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: How To Hit The Ball Softly In Squash
item.description: When you first start to play squash, you shouldn’t try to hit the ball too hard. That’s because you need to be able to control your swing.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Is Weight Training Good For Squash?
item.description: Like most of these types of questions, the simple answer is “it depends”.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: What is it like to play on a glass squash court?
item.description: A traditional squash court was made of bricks and plaster. It was white with red lines. Some had a back wall made of glass, which allowed more people to watch and gave the court a less constricted atmosphere.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Should I Buy Expensive Squash Shoes?
item.description: I often get asked “Should I Buy Expensive Squash Shoes?” and the simple answer is yes and no! The better question should be “Should I Buy Good Squash Shoes?” and the answer to that is a resounding YES!
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: The Power of Practice in Squash
item.description: Getting better at something is generally not rocket science. It’s often a case of setting aside time to practice. The problem is that most people don’t like practicing. Especially when it’s hard work.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Foot Faults in Squash
item.description: So the first question you might have is “What are foot faults in squash?”.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)

item.title: Do Not Watch The Ball All The Time In Squash
item.description: I recently read somebody advise another squash player to “Watch the ball at all times”.
item.author: squashcoachphillip@gmail.com (Phillip Marlowe)
